website_summaries.verdict: One of the best drift trike for riders of all sizes including larger adults looking to have some fun.
pros: Large seat can accommodate many body sizes and types
Handlebars are ergonomically positioned to provide a comfortable grip and control while using the trike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: If you put a lot of mileage on the wheels, put pvc sleeves around wheels to prolong life of the wheel
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great accommodation for special needs teens who want wheels!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Autistic teens who have never been able to master a 2 wheeled bike. They love this trike and I love to watch them ride it up and down our long paved drive and drift around the turn. This is one of the few things they will do outside and I hope they keep it up this summer!
customer_reviews.author: M. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 1 week, no replacement parts available
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for Christmas (2018) and in only 4 days the rear wheel already broke after a few times using it. I was expecting some damage to the wheel to happen but after maybe a few months, not days. I tried to find replacement wheels but they are out of stock and no indication of when they will be available. Found a web page that will have some only available by March 2019. Still waiting for a response from Razor.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Aguilar R

customer_reviews.title: Weak back tires
customer_reviews.text: Got my kids thes for their birthday. The party was November 3rd for 3 of my kids 12,12,17.. they have only rode them on our large concrete driveway and not very much I might add and in less then 2 weeks the back tires started splitting down the middle on all bikes... they love this trike bit it doesn’t hold up very well at all. Even more frustrating I can’t find replacements.
customer_reviews.author: A. Clark

customer_reviews.title: rear tires don't last 44 dollars for new pair with ...
customer_reviews.text: rear tires don't last 44 dollars for new pair with shipping. took 8 in pvc and sleeved them helps if you heat it first before sliding it over wheels
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No replacement parts for what is most likely to break
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. It’s awesome! But the whole thing is made to take a beating except the rear tires. They are plastic so you can power slide. And they are amazing. Except the break and Amazon does not offer replacement rear tires and Razor had been out of stock since at least November 2018. You can get a replacement part for everything else except the thing most likely to break.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough call but 3/5 for me.
customer_reviews.text: Love it but had to ditch the drift wheels. I’m 5’11” and 200lbs. When sliding sideways the rear wheels have a lip on the outside edge and can catch a rock/crack and break. They are not built heavy enough for adults. I ended up ditching the drift wheels and used ruber ones I bought at the hardware store. Still very happy with it due to its big size. I’m comfortable with either seat position, wife prefers the shorter position. I do love cruising with my son on it as does every one who visits sonit still gets 3/5.
customer_reviews.author: jason g.

customer_reviews.title: Minimal use, big hole in tire.
customer_reviews.text: 10 year old daughter received for Christmas. We had a long winter so she wasn’t able to ride it till May. After about 5 or 6 rides around the neighborhood, right on top of the back tire has a golf ball sizes hole in it. The tire is a hard plastic. I saw a previous review where they covered the back tires in a large pvc pipe to prevent wear down. Thought it was a good idea and was going to do it this year sometime but didn’t realize the tire was going to wear down in 3 weeks of barely any use.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Prigmore

customer_reviews.title: Awesome trike!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is awesome. I bought it for my 11 year old who has autism. He has a very hard time riding a “regular” bike and I wanted him to be able to ride with his 8 year old brother who has no issues riding a bicycle. This is a cool trike. None of the neighbor kids tease him about not riding a regular bike. They all ask to ride it. My only complaint is that his lower back gets really red when he rides for a long time at once sometimes resulting in a bruise. He just puts a small rolled towel behind his back and it’s helped a lot. Great trike and would definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: MamaB81

customer_reviews.title: Awesome trike!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality trike! Got this for my 12 year old special needs daughter who doesnt quite get the concept of pedaling yet so we thought that getting a larger tricycle would help her. We have only had it a day and she has come very far already! We thought all along that it might be a little tough for her to reach the pedals even with the seat and frame all the way up, and we were right! So we just moved the seat up one more notch with just two bolts holding and it's still very very sturdy and it fits perfect. We are very happy with our purchase and even more importantly, so is she!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Trike
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Down Syndrome son this trike for Easter in 2016. He's 18 and can't ride a regular bike, but so badly wants to. HE LOVES THIS BIKE!! All summer long he rode it and is out enjoying it right now as I write this (March). Best thing ever! It's very sturdy and he loves drifting on it! It definitely boosts his confidence and now we can all enjoy going on family bike rides together.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Connors

customer_reviews.title: Get bike
customer_reviews.text: My 9yo son has a disability where he doeant have normal balance and leg strength. We where looking for something he can ride without embarrassment of an old person 3 wheel bike, he is tall for his age. This bike let's him ride and be in style. His confidence is way up being able to bike now like a normal kid. Plus alot of people ask us where we got this awesome cool bike.
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a lot of adults love these
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and she loves it for being an adult. Seems like a lot of adults love these. Reminds them of the one they had as a child. Lots of fun. Be sure to see YouTube videos on how to use 10 inch PVC pipe as sleeves for the back wheels to make them last a long time and still be able to do stunts with it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Defective Beware
customer_reviews.text: I had the hubcap shake loose on one of the rear tires and when I took it off to find out why I found that when I compared the two back tires side by side, the one that shook loose was missing a wheel bearing. I'm lucky it didn't cause the whole tire to fall off. Don't buy this piece of junk. I thought it was cool at first, but it's not well built.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schlieter

customer_reviews.title: Grandchild love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I had bout 2 of these for my small grandchildren but was having trouble keeping the older one off 10 to 12 years old. So I bought this one to see how they like it. THEY LOVE IT. ICAN EVEN RIDE IT AND IT IS REALLE EASY TO PEDAL AND IS FUN!!! So I will be getting more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. T

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer support
customer_reviews.text: So I have mixed reviews. I bought this for my 12 y/o with autism who is 5’1. It’s a great size for him. It’s quite fast and he loves to drive it wild. The negatives- we immediately lost screws while riding it . Customer support is aweful. It’s a problem that screes don’t stay tight. Even the pedals only screw in and one of them flew off while he was riding It’s with it for the money but not worth more
customer_reviews.author: meghan tarantino

customer_reviews.title: Really cool quality questionable
customer_reviews.text: Bearings on front wheel completely shot in less than 30 days. Called customer support and waited on a dead line for 20 minutes after following the prompts. Won’t be buying another Razor product. I cam buy the part from their web site but feel parts that fail in 30 days should be free replacement. Wish a company like diamond back made this. It would have lasted more than a month.tried to email support seems like their emails support is broken as well. Not happy. Sure wish companies would just build quality versus a bunch of poor quality products that don’t last.
customer_reviews.author: vmt

customer_reviews.title: Money pit
customer_reviews.text: Rear wheels cracked then broke after less then a month of light use by a 10 year old. Replacement wheels are back ordered a months and cost $30 plus $14 in shipping. Not worth it. You’ll end up spending hundreds in wheels.
customer_reviews.author: christopherP

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun. Wear a helmet if doing anything crazy
customer_reviews.text: A lot of fun. Wear a helmet if doing anything crazy. I was launched of while trying to drift down hill. Helmet saved me. I hit my head hard.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Richter

customer_reviews.title: Not like child razor bike that spins
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has the razor bike like this and it is so much often. I would even ride it but it's dangerous with my legs being too long. I was super excited to find an adult version so i could ride with her and enjoy the fun with her. However, this version does not spin. It does work well as an adult tricycle, but what fun is that? Fun, but not for this price. It is also so wide that is hard to ride on sidewalks b/c the wheels stick out and hit the edges. I regret this splurge that not takes up a very large portion of our garage.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great trike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Ok. I bought 2 of these just before Christmas last year and they have been tons of fun. However, they do have some minor issues. The back wheels are poor quality and will break apart after a small amount of use. I ended up replacing them with pneumatic tires wrapped in a piece of 8” C900 water pipe, which works a thousand times better. Also, the seat sucks. It will leave a painful, red mark across your lower back. Other than that, great quality and tons of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Will Johnson

customer_reviews.title: has NOT rusted at all
customer_reviews.text: Very good it has not rusted at all. My son can ride it in snow and dirt even ice. Still no rust even his bike get rusted and he doesn't even ride His bikes in the winter but he can ride this all the time. Very very happy with this drift trike.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: We bought my special needs son a razor 360 about 3 years ago. He loves it, but at 15, his poor knees were in the handle bars. This was the perfect solution as he still has a ton of room to grow into it. It has a hand break which took a bit of getting used to for him, but it didn’t take long. The only thing I worry about is the back wheels being plastic as he is rough on things, but it is totally worth the price. My daughter loves that there is a place on the back made for people to stand on, so he has driven her down to the neighbor’s already.
customer_reviews.author: punkybear

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it now
customer_reviews.text: There are some cheap components to this drift trike, they are: - Wheel quality not that great. I'm talking about the actual rim. - Brakes are not that great. They squeak and need constant adjustments. - Sloppy wheel bearing in front wheel. Having said that - you won't even notice because you're going to be flying around on this thing like a kid. You will have a great time and it'll only cost you a bit over $100. I've had mine for a few days now. I ride it around the neighborhoods with the kids on their bikes. It's a blast! Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and speed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a big wheel race and it did not let me down. Let me forewarn anyone buying this for a child. Make sure they know how to control the brake because this trike WILL SPIN OUT ON A CURVE AND FLIP OVER at unsafe speeds. So, wear protective equipment. It is built with quality. The brakes are a little flimsy, but easily repairable. The front wheel provides great traction! I am 5'2" about 145lbs and I fit perfectly. Whether or not its hard to pedal up a hill really depends on your level of fitness. Its definitely not hard to pedal downhill or on flat surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: LDavis

customer_reviews.title: It’s the bombbbb! Yes I said bomb.
customer_reviews.text: Step 1. Put it together (20 minutes) Step 2. Find the first 5 yr old you see and challenge them to a race. (Child must be on big wheel) Step3. Destroy them!!! And tell them how great you are!! Lol... I’m a 34 year old woman who bought this for my 11 yr old. He happened to be at his dads when it arrived. I put it together and it became mine! I’m ordering him another one now. Lol.. No way I’m letting this thing go!!! I had so much fun today! Lol..
customer_reviews.author: Tiff

customer_reviews.title: Bummed but hopeful!
customer_reviews.text: Bunk so far, hoping to get some product support on Monday. Came packaged well, and assembling was a breeze but before I even put it together I noticed one of the rear wheels wasent spinning well. I thought perhaps it had something to do with the “drifting” process but NOPE. Once assembled and on the road the problem wheel makes a horrible grinding sound. Definitely a problem! Hope it can be rectified or replaced otherwise returning. And what a pain that will be! Will follow up. Bummed
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and fun
customer_reviews.text: This is incredibly fun and easy to use. It is extremely loud when you drift on it though, and I would recommend wearing long sleeves and a helmet if you are using it for drifting, because it can flip over and road rash is no fun, or a part of the fun if you are like my husband. Our daughter with autism has absolutely no problem using this, and she loves it! I love that it has a place for people to stand on the back to assist or ride along. Favorite purchase ever.
customer_reviews.author: molly

customer_reviews.title: A big wheel for an adult kid at heart..
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun beginners trike! I love it. It gives you a workout, it's very fun, I rode it for an hour, and it felt like I was 5 again! Great price, good product, can't wait for my next trike!
customer_reviews.author: Batman2.0

customer_reviews.title: Fun ride, probably wont last too long though
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'2". I can ride it, but have to make wide turns bc my leg hits the wheel on a sharp turn and my foot stops reaching the pedal. But it is still a fun ride. The back wheels are plastic...will probably wear down soon...which is the one bad thing...especially for the price. The back wheels should be better. The frame is sturdy! Not too bad of a time putting it together. I did it myself when my little guy was asleep.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for older kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: My daughter, who is 13, saw one of these at the local park and convinced the kid that owned it to let her play with. She fell in love with it so we got one as her big present for Christmas. It's fantastic!!! Sturdy enough that my husband and I can ride it too, but easy enough that our 8 year old son can play with it as well. It was very easy to put together and the whole family has had a blast with it.
customer_reviews.author: Phly Jambor

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but the wheels don't last without covers. See comments.
customer_reviews.text: Was fun to ride until the wheels broke. Razor website says they sell replacements but they're always out of stock and won't pre-order. If you want this you need to research making PVC covers for the wheels before you ride it, otherwise it'll sit dead once the wheels break.
customer_reviews.author: Willis9900

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old son wanted something other the. A bike. Found this and he loves it. I was afraid of his size that it would hold up but it did. He's 6'1 and 250 lbs. only down fault is the rear tires dont last long and you can only find the replacement on razor.com. And are a little pricey
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: My boys love these
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my 10 and 12 year old boys. I figured my 10 year old would have to grow into the drifter, but wasn't expecting my 12 year old to be too small for it also. I was able to move the seat closer by only using the closest holes to the pedals in the frame and the back holes in the seat. It's designed to have 4 bolts holding the seat to the frame, but it's still very sturdy only using 2. This is a cool trike. My boys ride them all day long and couldn't be more satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Sharonda Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Joy of Each Day!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Each ride on my New Razor Trike, reverses my age, I ride everyday and at 55 yrs of age, Ive never felt younger. Seniors or BobCats like myself, if you want to be energized buy the Razor Trike. I use my car door handles to lower myself and get myself out of the seat. Every senior should buy one its inexpensive and will better your HEALTH!!!! Thanks Amazon, you guys made a Dream Come True for Me!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tywanda R.

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Sturdier than expected
customer_reviews.text: Both my 10 yr old son and I were impressed with how sturdy the bike is. Easy to put together. If my son were any younger, and his legs shorter, I would have had to add padding to the back of the seat so he could reach the pedals. Very fun for both of us. We are going to start wearing helmets - this afternoon while racing circuits in an empty parking lot, we saw that at high speeds and hitting a curb and bumping into each other, there is potential to wipe out and fall out/over. Good leg workout for parent too! (like a spinning class)
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Fits adults, great for a big kid
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's 10th birthday. He is 5'5 and 170lbs...too big for all of the kid versions of these things. He absolutely loves it. The back wheels worry me as they are not rubber but a thick hard plastic (picture the wheels on a Lil Tykes toy but much more durable) and I'm concerned that after more use they will wear. But I can't dock a start based on what might happen, so five stars. My husband is 6'3 and he is able to ride it.
customer_reviews.author: Rana M H

customer_reviews.title: Great bike. Great price. Sturdy!!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Packaged very securely, relatively easy to put together and easy to follow instructions. The bike itself seems very sturdy and look forward to my son using it for a long time. The instructions also indicate where to buy replacement tires if you end up needing them after a while. Make note of it or keep the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Being the big kid that I am I had to have this!
customer_reviews.text: The value is consistent with the price. This is not a top of the line product. I purchased one for myself and one for my 14 year old . I had a hard time putting it together alone but, when he held the heavy parts up while I secured the screws things worked out better. I like it I feel like a big kid its noisy though I don't care for that part. I've only taken it out once. So maybe I'll just have to get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna

customer_reviews.title: so good. It is HUGE and big enough for an ...
customer_reviews.text: Only been riding for a few weeks (since it was a Christmas gift) So far, so good. It is HUGE and big enough for an adult. My 11 year old is 5'4" and 160# and we had to scoot the seat up for him. The biggest complaint I have is that when you make a sharp turn, your leg rubs the tire, so you can only make gradual turns. It is a real bike tire on the front and plastic wheels on back. Our younger sons like to stand behind the seat and go for a ride!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda W.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fun!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable! I'm 6' 225lbs 'tested' this out for myself because I was skeptical of the quality and performance. This FAR exceeded my expectations. Super easy assembly and very high quality. Bought for my two sons and they are drifting all over the neighborhood. Will buy one for myself and my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Norman

customer_reviews.title: Fun in these crazy times
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife to ride around the neighborhood during our Covid19 lockdown. Like: Very sturdy Easy to ride Fun Dislike: Not too hard to assemble...but you need an extra set of hands. It could be easier. The seatback is too low. It would be better if the seat back was 3-4 inches taller. My wife is 5'3" and just reaches the pedals with the seat set to the closest adjustment. If you are under 5'3" it would be tough to reach the pedals.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little trike, not great for cruising around town.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked how easy it was to put together, but after about an hour of messing around on it, I've noticed the seat gets real uncomfortable on your back and the handle bar grips are not so great. ( I immediately swapped the plastic pedals for metal ones which helped a lot) and the grips for ones I had off another bike. All in all though tons of fun, plus the back wheels are real noisy which is fun.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Just a whole lot of fun for the whole family.
customer_reviews.text: What do you get your grown son, who has everything he needs - An adult size big wheel, of course! I love these - got three of them for my adult son and his wife. Adults and grandchildren alike love to race them. You have to assemble these yourself but it's not too difficult. Had a little trouble with one of them because the breaks were installed on the wrong side out of the box, but once we figured it out - it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: best thing ever
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my son's 39th birthday so he can enjoy his childhood before 40. It was simple to put together, it is very sturdy and very well made, my son is 240lbs and he rode it just fine, it is very nice quality..
customer_reviews.author: kimmiewho

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy ever for my son!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it! He’s about 120 lbs and 5’3 it fits him perfect and has room for him to grow. Also, to my special needs parents this is great if your child can’t ride a bike yet but can pedal or push. I hardly ever see reviews for special needs kids under toys so thought I would mention my son has special needs and it saved the day! He’s been riding all day.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Drifts well
customer_reviews.text: First one came without a lock nut. Unfortunately I had to send the whole thing back. They sent a new one that had all the parts. Easy to put together with an extra set of hands. I love it and the kids love it. My only problem is that the seat does not adjust on the fly. You have to unscrew 4 Allen key screws. Good trike.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun!!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this trike as soon as possible. You will not regret it. I am a 250 pound make that has no issues with it. Tons of fun!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: TravisAmber

customer_reviews.title: and it rides sweet!!
customer_reviews.text: Rode it on our 15th annual Big Wheel Rally in Des Moines, IA this year to raise money for the Children's Cancer Connection. I'm 6'0, 230 lbs. and it rides sweet!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Hard seat, poor brake pads, but great fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trike for bigger kids who aren't into biking but don't playing outside. The seat is hard plastic with no back support, so I recommend adding pillow to help with that. The break pads that came with the trike are of poor quality as mine wore out after two weeks of use. However, they are easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Thuong Pham

customer_reviews.title: Don’t call it a trike... it’s a TIME MACHINE!!!
customer_reviews.text: My whole family loves this thing! We bought a vintage big wheel for my 4 year old and needed something so we could keep up with her. Feels like I’m a little kid again too! The teenagers love it just as much as I do! We have had a 240 lb person on it as well and it’s just fantastic and fun!! #nostalgia
customer_reviews.author: Oink

customer_reviews.title: cannot get replacement wheels
customer_reviews.text: This is a good design and assembles easily. Drift trikes have by design rear wheels that wear out- they are wear items much like brake pads on a car, only they wear out much more quickly. I ordered replacement rear wheels in December and they keep getting backordered, and here we are in May. Our rear wheels wore out weeks ago, and now the trikes are parked! I'm going to build custom wheels to avoid dealing with this in the future. I would give this trike 5 stars except for this. Maybe Razor will get it together soon, but this has been a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: D.E. NorCal

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY CENT
customer_reviews.text: This is some serious fun... its very noisy so you wont be riding quietly. BUT its an adult version that we all wish we had. I wish it came in more colors, as we are thinking of creating a tricycle gang in the neighborhood.... ha! My 11 yr old can even ride it, he just reaches the pedals. Loads of fun and the drift is legit. Buy one! Don't wait!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Imbrescia

customer_reviews.title: Fun Big boy toy
customer_reviews.text: Our soon to be 29 year old daughter asked for one for her birthday to keep up with her nephew and niece. My husband is turning 65 in May and wanted one too. I gave him his as an early birthday gift so he can be enjoying it with our grand children. Big success! I tried to attach a video but the file was too big. Brakes need some adjusting once it is assembled. Sorry
customer_reviews.author: redconk

customer_reviews.title: Cruising the street in my 64
customer_reviews.text: This is AMAZING! It’s actually a little big.... the seats up as far as it will go and i’m still a little too far back. I’m 5’3 for reference. My neighbors all came out to snicker at me as i drifted down the street.... but i think they’re just jelous. If you’re on the fence about this, just go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Ltfbs

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and super fun!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying in typical razor fashion, this is very well made. It is a lot of fun especially compared to an old green machine. Keep in mind that this is made for adults. My kids ar 4'7" and they don't come close to being able to reach the pedals. I'm guessing they'd need to be 5'2" at least.
customer_reviews.author: Dac45

customer_reviews.title: Got a bad one
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my granddaughter for Xmas. It was easy to put together and seemed very well built but there is something wrong with the front wheel. When you try to peddle it doesn’t move the wheel. So my granddaughter is very disappointed and so am I. Now I’ll have to start the long process of contacting razor and seeing what can be done to resolve this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved it so much, we bought two!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband because he's too tall (6’2”) for our Huffy Green Machines and felt left out whenever our niece and nephews visit. This trike fits him perfectly. I ended up getting a second one for myself. I'm 5’5” and I have the seat pushed all the way forward, while his seat is pushed all the way back. We take it for spins around the neighborhood and love racing them downhill.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fun for our blind son and the whole family.
customer_reviews.text: We originally bought one for my 9 year old blind son who loves 3 wheel trikes. They're the only bike he likes. And this one's not different. It's awesome! And the whole family can ride on it. So much fun we now have 3 sitting in our garage. Amazing family fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun!!
customer_reviews.text: This would have been awesome but we received it with a broken brake system. Then it was too big for my son, even with the seat way up, he couldn’t reach the pedals. I took it for a quick spin and had a blast on it!! Not a comfortable ride but definitely a lot of fun! Had it had a higher back I would have kept it for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Kim S

customer_reviews.title: A fun ride for all ages
customer_reviews.text: My 53 yr old wife loves cruising the neighborhood with this trike but to make it fit her 5ft 1in frame, I moved the seat forward about 2in. The front brake was upgraded to a good mountain bike brake. The rear wheels are plastic and slide easily...however too much sliding may wear them out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: bnj

customer_reviews.title: 16 year old toy!
customer_reviews.text: Get the kids unconnected!! My 16 year old bought this with his own money when I told him he had to play outside daily. He got this and loves its!! The weight limit rocks so he can be a kid again and get some exercise and vitamin D as well! This really is just a super neat bike! Some of our adult neighbors ride it too!! He's 5 ft 6 inches and 160lbs there is PLENTY of room!!
customer_reviews.author: Holly D

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sons, my 9 year old cant reach the peddles while sitting back in the seat and sliding forward is not an option because of the hard front edge at the crotch 😐 but thankfully my older son can ride it. It was very easy to assemble, my boys did it themselves. 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Momma2aldoboys

customer_reviews.title: Awesome trike but no replacement wheels
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this drift trike however there are NO replacement tires for it so don't waste your money on a one time use. It's great until the tires wear out, which is about 3 months. Razor keeps telling me they are on back order. What for 3 months now and now they are telling me there is no time frame. Not happy! Save yourself the headache and DONT buy from Razor!
customer_reviews.author: Someone that is unhappy

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: These things are great! My father bought 2 of them for my nephews to build and ride while visiting. They were easy to put together and fun for everyone. My nephews, my sister and brother in law, my dad, my adult kids, everyone loved these things. Would definitely buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: shannon m. hilliker

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Santa brought this to my kiddo and he is so happy with it! He has barely gotten off of it since Christmas morning. He's 11, a little on the short side, and he puts a pillow in the seat to fit better. Comfortable enough for adults to ride also. It's very sturdy, much better quality than we anticipated. The only downfall is that the wheels are very loud when drifting. We put a curfew on it so our son doesn't disturb the neighbors. Very cool trike!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL 😡😡😡😡😡😤😤😤😤😤😤
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awful and dangerous the pedals don’t work good and every time my son turned the tire rubbed against his leg. We threw the box away and now I have to find a huge box to return this piece of junk 😡
customer_reviews.author: Donna F.

customer_reviews.title: Well built!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to ride around with my daughter on her drift trike. She loves to ride around with me in the driveway. This one doesn't spin out like the Razor trike she has, but I'm not really trying to spin out either. This is a quality product, well-built.
customer_reviews.author: SBell

customer_reviews.title: FUN FUN FUN
customer_reviews.text: Ohhh myyyyy yeeeesssss!!!! Absolutely love this!!!!! So much fun!!! My husband and I were laughing like kids!! You can’t help but have a good time. Of course now my child and my husband want one. An absolute good time. Brings back my childhood memories of the Big Wheel. Also, I did manage to drift around a corner and was utterly thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Kelene Williams

customer_reviews.title: Bad QA, pedal mechanism broken
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this used (very good condition) and when I assembled it and tried to pedal, they didn't turn the front wheel.. so there's obviously something broken within the freehub of the front wheel, and it's spinning in both directions. I don't know what kind of inspection this product underwent to qualify it for resale, but this issue seems like something that should have been caught..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon1

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have so much fun on this drift bike. Its for older kids ( high school) or adults. Its easy to use and a nice color. It took me under 20 minutes to build. I'm impressed with Razor's products and its replacement parts too. Thank you Razor!
customer_reviews.author: Mr nice guy

customer_reviews.title: Favorite X-mas Gift!
customer_reviews.text: This was my 14 yo sons favorite x-mas gift, even over his electronics! (Parent score!) He has a blast riding around the neighborhood especially with all the hills! I’ve also tried it myself and thought it was super fun!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: 6’4” 240 and Doing Fine!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband for his birthday and he couldn’t be happier! He’s having a blast and I love seeing how happy this makes him. Definitely NOT another wallet, watch, or pair of slippers! Best birthday gift EVA!
customer_reviews.author: The mominator

customer_reviews.title: Not for kids
customer_reviews.text: My son had the kids version and loved it and didn’t want a traditional bicycle so I bought this for him to grow into. He’s 10 and his feet just barely make it to the pedals. THE SEAT NEEDS TO BE MADE ADJUSTABLE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vita Ray

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Kiddo loves it. She is younger than the recommended age but she doesn't use it for drifting just for riding around. I wish they made a set of tires for the back that you could change them from the hard plastic to a rubber wheel.
customer_reviews.author: anna keigley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike!!
customer_reviews.text: Great bike! So much fun!!! Easy to drift! Only complaint is that after a long day of drifting the little back if the sit can dig in to you back and make you pretty sore. But it's still an awesome bike!
customer_reviews.author: Jrlife

customer_reviews.title: Well... I think it’s cool!
customer_reviews.text: The package came in decent shape, well protected and partially assembled. The Bigwheel itself was easily put together and came with step by step simple instructions. The tools it came with were subpar and striped out after the second bolt. Over all it’s pretty cool and turn lots of heads while riding it. I gave it a custom paint job and put new grips. The flag pole had to go it rubs on your back and is very uncomfortable. And if anyone knows where to get a coushined seat replacement please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: DaSamsquanch

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: So much fun for adults. I know the weight limit says something around 180 or something, but my overweight brother in law is about 280 and rides it just fine (he struggles getting up, but that is fun for us to watch). The seat, when all the way back, is good for about 6.1", over that and you may not be able to peddle as well. We bought three, and they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Rangel

customer_reviews.title: Son loves trike but asks for helmet and gloves too
customer_reviews.text: Son loves it, wife is happy our son loves it. I would recommend This can only be ridden if children are a bare minimum 4 feet 10 inches tall with shoes on. Otherwise, they can’t peddle this. 5 feet tall or taller would be better. Easy set up. Our son now wants to have the helmet and gloves pictured on the box. Note, that is not included.
customer_reviews.author: s. johnson

customer_reviews.title: Fun! But needs small modifications
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun! I’d give it five stars but it’s quality is just not quite there... the front forks twist when the front wheel is loaded up, and the brakes are not effective. Requires some modification for further fun! Still it’s a blast to ride and I would totally recommend it to my friends
customer_reviews.author: Kolbi Tabakci

customer_reviews.title: Adult size fun!
customer_reviews.text: Cool drifter! Bought for my husband and we both have a great time playing on it! He’s 6’ - 180 lbs and sits comfortably. Easy to ride and lots of fun! Ps our kids have fun on it too.
customer_reviews.author: LISA

customer_reviews.title: That the kids understand that they can get hurt on it if they dont learn to use it carefully.
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my grandson for Christmas and he really likes it. He had a problem not getting to crazy on it till he learned how to use it. After a slight crash the first time he used it he has learned how to use it more carefully. He is 11and a good age for this trike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very fun, easy to drift recommend over 4’11 to ride
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my 8 year old boy as a birthday present however, it is a bit too big for him right now. My husband and I did try it out and it is very easy to drift and brake. This would be a great gift for a kid or adult over 4’11”.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Rutledge

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectations well
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely big enough for big kids/adults. My 7 year old cant make it work. It drifts well and everyone has a ton of fun with it, our only complaint would be the seat gets a little uncomfortable after a while. If built with a cushion, it would be more comfortable. Not a deal break though!
customer_reviews.author: Jayo

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: The neighborhood kids couldn’t wait to ride this trike. They loved it. The brakes are broken after so much use. Our neighbors bought one too. Brake cable broke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You cannot put into words how awesome these Trikes are
customer_reviews.text: During Quarantine one of my neighbors found these trikes and thought it may be fun for a few of us to get them and ride around our neighborhood. What started out as just a stupid purchase has turned into over 30 guys joining our group and a Tik Tok video of us riding that has reached over 4.7 Million Views. These are incredibly fun and easily customized to make the ride even more exciting. Highly Recommend getting a crew together and going drifting!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Murray

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend... great trike for Dad
customer_reviews.text: Best $100.00 you’ll spend on a toy for yourself... I’m 6’4” and have a blast on this thing. Bought two, buddies and I rip up and down the street, our kids get jealous.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Powers

customer_reviews.title: No hardware
customer_reviews.text: Box was messed up when I received and found out that it is missing all the hardware
customer_reviews.author: Thomas cardenas

customer_reviews.title: Little to short
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 10 year old grand daughter. She is a little short for it so we had to move the seat to the farthest it could go. Still legs are a little short. So we will have to make something else to work.
customer_reviews.author: L. K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: The pedal arm fall off. The handle bar came lose on the ride. Not to crazy about the buy. I had to tighten every bolt on the bike as it was all lose.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Love it for our 8 yr old
customer_reviews.text: Love it! We bought for our tall 8 year old. He wouldn't ride a traditional bike so this was a good option for him. Even though he is tall, he still struggles a little to reach the pedals. But he manages!! I am 5'4" and can reach the pedals with the seat adjusted all the way forward.
customer_reviews.author: Valencia

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave drift trike in the rain, even for a short time.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible, but don't leave it in the rain--they use a very inexpensive "friction clutch" which is immediately destroyed if the unit gets wet. Friction clutches are quite expensive, and a very inexpensive model is used in this unit for cost savings. Be sure to keep this drift trike out of the rain. Other than this and an incredible unit that we will have to dispose of as the new front wheel is quite expensive and you have to pay for shipping too.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell G. Kirk

customer_reviews.title: I like that it made a good gift for a parent
customer_reviews.text: I like that it made a good gift for a parent. It adds fun to one's day plus makes a great conversation piece. I hope to be able to put in golf cart wheels for better traction.
customer_reviews.author: lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Very fast shipping and they had free shipping to Hawaii!
customer_reviews.text: These trikes are awesome!!!!! I bought 2 of these. One for grandson, and one for me. We had friends over right after I got them. Everyone was having a blast. Some of these guys were over 300 pounds and these trikes handled w/o a problem. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Donald W. Denison

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun
customer_reviews.text: My son used to ride his big wheel all the time. He is now in his thirties and I bought this for him at Christmas. He loves it and has a lot of fun riding it. His wife will get on it and ride some too.
customer_reviews.author: Avery N. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fun Fun Fun!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my husband for father's day and got myself one! We absouletly love these. Just so much fun brings back childhood memories of riding a big wheel. We had so many people stop us and ask where we got them. We encouraged them to buy one so the whole neighborhood could ride out!!! Well worth the money! Only thing I would recommend is a cushion for your bum! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of the razor two weeks later trikes one of them had a rear tire split in half. I called the manufacturer and was told not covered by warranty. Can't even order new wheels because there on back order. I wouldn't recommend anybody to buy this item there's no use because the warranty and quality isn't good.
customer_reviews.author: michael Drogich Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great price compared to other trikes. My 6 year old helped me put it together. The front brakes are not the best so be prepared for making adjustments. The smile on my daughter’s face as we ride our big wheels together is priceless and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Sal O.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value! Very well made!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 year old son. Very durable. This will last years, as he is still needing to grow into it. He loves it! I even tried it, and I love it! I am his father! Nothing like a grown man speeding down the sidewalk!
customer_reviews.author: Todd K

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun but recommended for ages 14+ as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Very cool looking and extremely solid. I assembled in 15 minutes with no issues. Got this for my 12 year old, she is tall and it is still a little too big for her. Packaging says ages 14 and up and this is probably the best age for the trike as advertised. I am 6'6" and I was able to drive it without too much discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Joel G

product_meta.title: Razor DXT Drift Trike
product_meta.description: Built for edge-of-your-seat Downhill drifting action. Let it all out from the freewheeling straights to the tightest curves. Full size steel frame, moto-style construction and 10 inch.Clamp: Moto-style, double, alloy
feature_bullets: Where Downhill Meets Drift. Ages-14 and up. Maximum weight-198 pounds
Steel trike style frame combined with Super Slider POM rear wheels
Riders can power slide through corners, throw fish tails or fast 180s!
Front free-wheel with BMX style platform pedals and alloy crank
Features: moto-style handlebars, pro-style grips, triple crown fork, adjustable bucket style seat, and tow hook attachment, grip tape on rear axle

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
